info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 3:39PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...An area of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Moffat County through 415 PM MDT... At 338 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong thunderstorms 26 miles northeast of Dinosaur, or 48 miles east of Vernal, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. Frequent lightning is also expected with this SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Moffat County, including the following locations... Elk Springs and Greystone. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 2 and 6, near mile marker 11, and between mile markers 30 and 50. Colorado 64 near mile marker 1. Colorado 318 between mile markers 23 and 51. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
